A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like: With glaring plotholes\, forced humor\, head scratching writing and misuse of Luke Skywalker arguably the most popular Star Wars character. The Last Jedi lacks the spirit of Rogue One and the Star Wars experience many fans wanted - especially the ones who have been there since the original trilogy.\nWith Rian Johnson and J.J. Abrams leading movies in the future\, this may not be The Star Wars you are looking for.\nThe Last Jedi also brings up the question: What movie did the critics watch?
